prompt: what kind of poem rhymes on every even numbered line?
response: The poem that fits the description is called an "ABAB poem." In an ABAB poem, the first and third lines (the "A" lines) rhyme with each other, while the second and fourth lines (the "B" lines) rhyme with each other. Technically, this means that the even-numbered lines (lines 2 and 4) rhyme with each other. That being said, there are other types of poetry that involve end rhymes on even-numbered lines, such as the "ABAB CDCD EFEF" rhyme scheme. The specific type of poem you are thinking of may depend on the context in which it is being used.

The even-numbered lines (lines 2 and 4) rhyme with each other
There are other types of poetry that involve end rhymes on even-numbered lines
The "ABAB CDCD EFEF" rhyme scheme is a type of poetry that involves end rhymes on even-numbered lines
The specific type of poem you are thinking of may depend on the context in which it is being used.
